description.narrative: National Societies across Europe and the IFRC are at the forefront of the response to irregular migration into Europe, mainly of people seeking asylum. Almost every Red Cross Society in Europe is engaged in activities to prevent and alleviate the suffering faced by people on the migratory trail. In 2015 the domestic capacities of Red Cross Societies in some countries have been overwhelmed, leading other National Societies to provide financial, personnel, material, and moral support. BRC contributed to the appeals in Turkey, Greece, Italy, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia (FYROM), Serbia, Hungary, Â Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina as well as the IFRC Europe Regional Office appeal. Furthermore, BRC has been responding to the refugee crisis since 2015 by supporting Red Cross work across Europe with personnel, funds and other practical support. While the rapid movement of people through Greece has stopped, BRC continued to respond to the refugees situated in camps across Greece - with a focus on Northern Greece. As many camps are closing, BRC is now providing support to HRC and IFRC in Thessaloniki with the aim of reaching urban migrants in the city (see UGSR project page). Also, currently supporting in Italy where large number of people continue to arrive on boats (please see MMPAT project page for more information).
